intro: Oenanthe alatinervis, commonly known as the slender water dropwort, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, arrow-shaped leaves that are often slightly hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in moist or wet environments such as marshes and stream banks. Oenanthe alatinervis is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables.
